entry.title: How the Tax Reform in Brazil Impacts SAP Users
entry.content:
Clique aqui para a versão em português.

Tax reform in Brazil is a topic of great relevance for companies that need to adapt to these legal changes. For SAP users, it is important to understand how the reform affects logistical and financial processes, be aware of implementation deadlines, and know what solutions SAP provides to ensure a smooth transition.

Implementation Timeline of the Tax Reform

  • 2026: The tax reform begins to be tested, with initial lower rates of 0.9% for the Contribution on Goods and Services (CBS) and 0.1% for the Tax on Goods and Services (IBS).
  • 2027: CBS comes into effect, replacing PIS and Cofins. The IPI rate will be zeroed, except for industrialized products in the ZFM.
  • 2028: Last year of ICMS and ISS without changes.
  • 2029: Gradual elimination of ICMS and ISS, with an annual reduction of 10% in their rates, as part of the replacement by IBS.
  • 2033: Full adoption of the new tax regime, with the extinction of ICMS and ISS.

SAP Deliverables
SAP is committed to supporting its clients during the transition to the new tax model. SAP solutions are being updated to meet the new legal requirements, ensuring that companies can adapt to the changes.

SNOTE: Note Analyzer tool
We strongly recommend using the Note Analyzer tool to organize the implementation of SAP Notes for this solution. Refer to SAP Note 3200109 for instructions on this tool and use the XML file attached to SAP Note 3561376 to list the SAP deliverables for Brazil's Tax Reform. The latest version of Note Analyzer introduces a feature that displays the implementation order in the "comments" column after importing the XML. Follow this order, even if some SAP Notes are not relevant to your business. Note that the tool provides the correct order but not a complete list of prerequisites for the SAP Notes. Therefore, additional analysis may be necessary to address potential dependencies.

Important observations during the implementation of SAP notes
For each SAP Note to be implemented, take a moment to read its textual content. This way, you can become informed about known prerequisite notes, manual steps to be executed before or after the automatic implementation of correction instructions, and be aware of other instructions. Reading the content of each note to be implemented can help avoid implementation issues and the need for rework.
Moreover, it is crucial not to proceed with the implementation of subsequent SAP Notes, leaving previous notes incorrectly implemented in the system (status: incompletely implemented), as this leads to a corrupted system and the absence of necessary contexts and objects for future implementations. Therefore, when implementing a list of SAP Notes, ensure that each note is implemented correctly and completely.

Support Resources
SAP provides several support resources, including:

  • SAP Work Zone - Brazil - Tax Reform Localization: It allows SAP customers and partners to share information and collaborate on matters related to the Tax Reform. This space is updated daily.
  • The Regulatory Change Manager tool: Announcements of legal changes and planning of solution deliverables.
  • SAP Note 3561376 - Tax Reform Leading SAP Note for reading: It describes the delivery and support strategy for the Brazil Tax Reform solution. This frequently updated SAP Note lists the solution deliverables as they are released to customers. Attached to it is an always-updated XML file to be used on the Note Analyzer, assisting you in the implementation of SAP Notes in the proper order.
  • SAP Note 3637842 - Brazil Tax Reform - Testing Limitations with SEFAZ for reading: This informational SAP Note highlights the processes not yet supported by SAP related to the Tax Reform in Brazil, especially regarding scenarios to be tested with SEFAZ. This note will be updated regularly.
  • KBA 3642384 - Brazil Tax Reform Troubleshooting Guide: In addition to explaining SAP's deliverables and providing direct links to the Regulatory Change Manager platform for Tax Reform topics, this Troubleshooting KBA helps resolve potential issues already identified during the implementation of SAP Notes. By offering solutions to common problems, this KBA is continuously updated to include new information.

SAP ERP - Help Portal

  • Tax Groups and Tax Types Added to Nota Fiscal
  • CBS and IBS Taxes as Statistical Values in Nota Fiscal
  • Define Tax Situation for CBS and IBS
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Sales
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRA
  • Enablement of NBS for CBS and IBS Determination in Purchasing Scenarios
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRJ Pricing Procedure
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal for CBS and IBS Taxes
  • Nominal Rate Calculation and Nota Fiscal Texts for CBS and IBS in Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using RVABRA and RVXBRA Pricing Procedures
  • Determine Tax Situation for CBS and IBS Business Add-In
  • Fields Added for Nominal Rates in Nota Fiscal BAdI Structure
  • Field Added to Nota Fiscal Table for IBS Tax Calculation
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Purchasing
  • Enhanced Tax Determination with Tax Situation for CBS and IBS for Sales Processes
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal BAdI and BAPIs structures
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Goods Movement

SAP S/4HANA - Help Portal

  • Tax Groups and Tax Types Added to Nota Fiscal
  • CBS and IBS Taxes as Statistical Values in Nota Fiscal
  • Define Tax Situation for CBS and IBS
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Sales
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRA
  • Enablement of NBS for CBS and IBS Determination in Purchasing Scenarios
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRJ Pricing Procedure
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal for CBS and IBS Taxes
  • Nominal Rate Calculation and Nota Fiscal Texts for CBS and IBS in Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using RVABRA and RVXBRA Pricing Procedures
  • Determine Tax Situation for CBS and IBS Business Add-In
  • Fields Added for Nominal Rates in Nota Fiscal BAdI Structure
  • Field Added to Nota Fiscal Table for IBS Tax Calculation
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Purchasing
  • Enhanced Tax Determination with Tax Situation for CBS and IBS for Sales Processes
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal BAdI and BAPIs structures
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Goods Movement

Implementation Deadline for Customers
SAP customers must have the SAP solutions related to the tax reform fully implemented and tested by December 2025 to ensure compliance with the new obligations starting from January 2026.

Government Validation
Currently, it is possible to test document approval with the fields for the new taxes in SEFAZ's homologation environment, and optionally, to send them in production as well. SEFAZ's production environment will begin validating the new XML fields of NF-e related to the tax reform taxes starting in January 2026. Until that date, filling out these new fields is optional and, even if filled, should not cause rejection in NF-e approval.
From January 2026, filling out the fields for the new taxes will be mandatory, with legal significance, for electronic tax documents in the production environment. Non-compliance may lead to the rejection of the invoices.

Conclusion
The tax reform in Brazil represents a significant legal change, so be mindful of the deadline for compliance.
The SAP informational notes listed above and the troubleshooting KBA will be continuously updated to ensure you have access to relevant information as you update your system.
Utilize the available resources and engage in the Work Zone to clarify any doubts.

entry.title: What's New in SAP Convergent Charging 2025 FPS0
entry.content:
New Release

PUBLIC

 

October 2025

Dear Convergent Charging and BRIM community,

We are glad to announce that effective October 15th, 2025, the SAP Convergent Charging 2025 FPS0 release is now generally available for our customers.

With this release we have introduced few highly impactful features that will significantly benefit our customers.  These includes new Multiclient support of SAP CC, re-rating of contracts using shared allowances and introduction of Joule assistant with Conversational search to make SAP CC more robust, ready to handle new age subscription scenarios as well as help customers bring down saving on hardware and maintenance costs

Let's dive into these latest product features in detail highlighting our latest pricing and charging capabilities, as part of the SAP Billing and Revenue Innovation Management (BRIM) suite.

Multi-client support for SAP Convergent Charging

In a typical SaaS business model, enterprises often operate multiple system landscapes to support various stages of their operations. For instance, a dedicated SAP Convergent Charging (CC) server for development, another for testing, and one for UAT or production. While such setups ensure isolation and compliance, they also introduce significant operational and cost overhead. Each server requires its own installation, maintenance, and upgrade cycle, resulting in higher total cost of ownership (TCO) and increased administrative complexity.

For SaaS providers managing multiple B2B customers or internal business units, this challenge amplifies maintaining several SAP CC servers becomes both operationally inefficient and commercially unsustainable.

With the SAP CC 2025 FPS0 release, this long-standing challenge is now resolved through the introduction of Multi-Client Support. Customers can now host multiple logical clients (such as development, testing or UAT) on a single SAP CC server, fully aligned with the client concept in SAP S/4HANA. Each client operates as a completely isolated box, with its own business and technical data thus ensuring data segregation.

With this feature you can not only reduces infrastructure and licensing costs but also simplifies upgrades and maintenance, making it a major step forward in enabling cost-efficient scalability and streamlined operations for SAP CC customers.

Figure 1: Multiclient support for SAP Convergent Charging

The Benefits

  • Massive cost efficiency, simplified upgrades and lifecycle management, consistent governance, and seamless alignment with S/4HANA multi-client strategies, empowering organizations to scale smarter, not heavier.

 For easier implementation from Cockpit

  • New Fiori app, Manage Clients, available in the SAP CC Cockpit that enables System Administrators to export and import clients, their related JCo destinations (used for the communication between an SAP CC system and an SAP S/4HANA system) and customer management areas.

For more information about this new feature, refer to Multiclient Management in SAP CC (New) topic on the SAP Help Portal. And refer to the SAP Note 3636174 - One SAP Convergent Charging system connected to multiple S/4HANA systems for implementation guidelines.

Re-rating for contracts using shared allowances within a sharing group

Imagine a global travel platform such as REX Corporation, offering a Flight Booking-as-a-Service platform to airlines and travel partners. Through this platform, multiple partner agencies or airline business units share a common monthly allowance of booking transactions or API calls under a sharing group. Now imagine that, in such a complex shared allowance setup, after the billing cycle has closed, REX Corporation discovers that a portion of booking transactions was incorrectly rated into the next month’s billing period. Since the usage allowance is shared across multiple contracts, this results in imbalanced consumption reporting, revenue leakage, and potential audit risks.

Until now, in SAP BRIM we supported end-to-end shared allowance management, however, support of automated re-rating for these shared allowances were not possible. As a result, such re-rating requests often had to be handled manually, thus increasing complexity and introducing a high risk of human error.

With the SAP CC 2025 FPS0 release, this limitation is now resolved. Businesses can now trigger a complete re-rating for all contracts within a sharing group that consume shared allowances, directly from Convergent Invoicing (CI). The system automatically re-rates the entire sharing group together, ensuring synchronized allowance recalculation, accurate billing adjustments, and audit-safe financial compliance, without any custom intervention.

Figure 2: Re-rating for contracts using shared allowances within a sharing group

Benefits

  • Improve support for B2B use cases using account split and/or shared allowances

To support this feature end-to-end, we have introduced enhancements across SOM, CC, and CI. For more detailed information about this new capability, refer to the following links:

  • More Information
    • Rerating of Contracts Using Shared Allowances Within Sharing Groups (New)
    • What's New in SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 > Rerating of Shared Allowances
    • SAP S/4HANA > Subscription Order Management > Shared Allowances
    • SAP Note 3630401 - Recommendations for Using the Rerating Feature in BRIM

Conversational search through Joule, our AI copilot

With this release, SAP Convergent Charging introduces AI-powered conversational search via Joule, enabling users to simply ask questions in natural language and instantly receive answers sourced directly from official SAP Help Portal documentation. Now you don’t need to manual keyword searches or navigate through multiple SAP help pages, rather, get all your queries answered in a conversational way from the Joule.

This capability can be implemented through the new Joule plugin integrated into the SAP CC Cockpit, onboarding the conversational search experience seamlessly inside the product UI. It significantly accelerates onboarding, learning, and day-to-day operations for business and IT users. Please note: this feature is available exclusively in SAP Convergent Charging, private cloud edition.

Figure 3: SAP CC Conversational search

 

  • Benefits
    • Improve user satisfaction through the ability to express business requirements in natural language
    • Enable quicker access to user-enablement content summarized in a crisp answer
    • Save valuable time by avoiding browsing through a long search-result list and reading into several topics to find the correct information

For more information about this new scope item, refer to SAP Note 3617641 - Integrating Joule with SAP Convergent Charging for Conversational Search.

Other Enhancements

In addition to the features mentioned above, SAP Convergent Charging 2025 FPS00 also introduces other enhancements:

Enhancements of Web services for integration with SAP CPQ

To further improve integration with SAP CPQ, SAP CC now offers enhanced web services to support consumption-based usage charging directly during quote creation and management.

With this enhancement, CPQ can dynamically create range tables when a new quote is generated and also modify existing range tables during quote adjustments, enabling sales teams to configure complex usage-based pricing models with greater accuracy and flexibility. This significantly improves sales agility with more quotation process, pricing precision, and end-to-end automation for subscription and usage-driven business models.

  • Benefits
    • Improve the integration capabilities between SAP CPQ and SAP Convergent Charging

Find more detail about this feature from SAP Help portal: Catalog Management > Import Range Table Data from CSV  &  Import Mapping Table Data from CSV

 

Replacement of Core Tool functionalities by functionalities in Cockpit Fiori apps

As part of SAP CC’s strategic shift toward a modern, unified user experience, we are gradually transitioning key Core Tool functionalities into Cockpit Fiori apps. With the 2025 release of SAP Convergent Charging, this phased replacement has officially begun. As previously communicated in our April 2025 SAP Blog, the transition will be executed role by role, ensuring 100% functional coverage of the existing Core Tool. You can find the detailed announcement in the SAP Blog page.

  • In the first phase of this journey, the User Administrator role is now fully migrated and will exclusively use the Fiori-based "Manage User Accounts" and "Manage Permissions" apps within the Cockpit. This evolution not only aligns with SAP’s Fiori-first UX strategy, but also delivers a more intuitive, consistent, and future-ready user experience across the SAP BRIM suite.

The User Administrator role will use the dedicated Fiori apps available in the Cockpit: 

  • Manage User Accounts
  • Manage Permissions

Find more details, refer to the SAP Note  3589935 - Replacement of user account management functionalities in Core Tool by functionalities in Cockpit Fiori apps as of SAP Convergent Charging 2025

 

More Information

SAP Convergent Charging 2025 FPS00 has been released to customers on October 15th, 2025,  and is available on the SAP Software Download Center.

For more information on SAP Convergent Charging 2025 FPS 00, check out the following links:

  • What’s New in 2025 FPS00
  • Release Information Note (RIN) for SAP Convergent Charging 2025
  • Product Page on SAP Help Portal à Convergent Charging
  • Business AI in BRIM: Joule Help Page     Initial Setup of Joule for BRIM
  • Questions and Answers for SAP Convergent Charging in SAP Community
  • SAP BRIM Customer Influence Portal > Opportunity area “Solution Quotation and BRIM”

entry.title: Re: How to add landed costs to the material cost when fre...
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh  ,

There are two scenarios:

  1. If the material is not yet consumed before you receive the broker invoice, you can use the Inventory Revaluation document to adjust the cost.

  2. If the material is already consumed, then while doing the GRN, create a Landed Cost document with an assumed value and proceed. Later, when you receive the actual invoice from the broker, you can reconcile and adjust the difference under the relevant expense account.

entry.title: KSS2 Incorrectly Calculates Cosntrol Costs
entry.content:
Hi Colleagues,

I need some help because looking at the control costs we keep our heads scratching. Maybe there is something we overlooked.

The case is as follows:

  • We have posted 5 Activities on a production Cost Centre. Some of the credit came from confirmation (like MFBF), some from KB21N.
  • There are number of Cost Elements posted on this CC.
  • One Activity doesn’t have corresponding Cost Element posted in this period.
  • All Activites and Cost Elements are included in a OKES assignment. There is no loose cannon.
  • All Cost Elements posted are linked to an assignment, there is no activity independent cost on this CC.
  • The Cost Centre is assigned to the Splitting Structure in OKEW.
  • There are Cost Elements which are assigned to multiple OKES assignments but on this Cost Centre, all Cost Elements posted is assigned to only one assignment. So, we have a 1:1 model.
  • 1 Activity Types’s actual price will be calculated based on activity quantity, the rest based on capacity. (act. prices indicator is 5 and 6, respectively).
  • No Activity quantity nor Costs planned for this Cost Centre nor we have scheduled activity only Capacity is planned.
  • The Actual Price calculation method is set to Periodic in OKEQ.

After running KSS2, we have a mysterious amount of 27.625 which was assigned to the activity which didn’t have corresponding actual costs, then added again to ACT01, and ACT04 got this amount as Control Cost. Doesn’t make sense AT ALL.

Any hint will be warmly welcomed.

Cheers

M.

entry.title: Re: Error while testing-'Electronic Payment File - Receiv...
entry.content:
Good day @bcrao 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

Incoming Payments with Electronic Bank Statements, Process Payment Files

Payments and Bank Communication in S/4HANA Cloud, In-House Banking Integration to Financial Accounting Systems

To summarise, when testing the Electronic Payment File – Receive AP in public cloud and you get the error you mentioned, it means your inbound XML is missing the required MessageHeader node defined in the API schema. To fix it, i suggest:

  • You ensure your payload contains <MessageHeader> and <PaymentFile> blocks.
  • Encode the file content in Base64.
  • Verify your BCM configuration (file type, inbound channel, and bank settings).
  • Use the official API schema from SAP API HUB for payload validation.

This will ensure you inbound file gets accepted by BCM and visible in “Bank Communication Monitor”

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Create transparency across your SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environments
entry.content:
Once SAP BTP has been established as platform for side-by-side extensions to your SAP solutions, it becomes important to keep an overview of the deployed extensions. Earlier this year, I blogged about the discovery of SAP Build projects to push them into the SAP discovery inbox of SAP LeanIX. Now I am excited to share with you that we just released the next step in our discovery journey: The discovery of applications deployed to SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment. This includes their service bindings, the used Cloud Foundry buildpack versions, and a grouping if multi target applications (MTA) were deployed.

What you gain

For you as enterprise architect, this means you can easily get an overview of all the deployed applications across the whole SAP BTP global account. If your company has more than one global account in place, the integration can be setup several times and all discoveries will be sent to LeanIX’ “SAP discover inbox”. After adding applications relevant for your productive landscape to your inventory, you can easily browse through the deployed apps without the need of access to the SAP BTP subaccounts. Following the SAP LeanIX modeling guidelines, applications are related to platform fact sheets which represent the global- and subaccounts. Furthermore, service bindings to SAP BTP services are modeled as IT Components.

Based on customer feedback, the SAP discovery inbox will suggest an IT Component based on the used Cloud Foundry buildpack version.
Imagine that with one click, you can see which Cloud Foundry deployments across your SAP BTP landscape are using an outdated buildpack version!

This is what you need

The setup is described in SAP Help Portal, but I want to point out the headlines here:

  • What you need is a platform user in your tenant of the SAP Cloud Identity Service, for which the generation and authentication with certificates is enabled. Trust between the IAS tenant and the SAP BTP global- and subaccounts needs to be established.
  • Your development teams need to add this platform user to all respective Cloud Foundry organizations and spaces which should be crawled. We recommend adding this user to the spaces which include your productively used applications.
  • With this platform user, its certificate & related password, the list of used Cloud Foundry API Servers, and a service key to SAP Cloud Management Service, you are good to go. SAP LeanIX will start fetching all deployments, service bindings, and buildpacks.

Feedback is welcome!

Try it out and let me know your feedback! The roadmap item includes a link for finding a joint time to talk. Furthermore, you can leave a comment here or meet me at ASUG Tech Connect this week in Louisville, KY.

entry.title: Re: Guidance for Creating Sales Order from External Syste...
entry.content:
Good day @Thanushree1999 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

API_SALES_ORDER_SRV, Error 403 when Create Sales Order using API_SALES_ORDER_SRV

Create Communication Arrangement SAP_COM_0109, Configuring the OAuth 2.0 Client

Sales Order creation via OData API calls

https://help.sap.com/viewer/DRAFT/0f9408e4921e4ba3bb4a7a1f75f837a7/1811.500/en-US/d9494291232f416fb7...

To summarise, in public cloud, the easiest way to create Sales Order from an external system is by using the standard A2X API (API_SALES_ORDER_SRV) with OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials authentication. Best practice is to simply: Create a communication arrangement (which you have already done), generate an OAuth token, POST a JSON payload to /A_SalesOrder, Map external fields to standard S4H fields, optionally use SAP Cloud Integration or Groovy scripts for dynamic field mapping.

This approach is fully clean core complaint, secure, and scalable for automation. For testing, Postman + OAuth token is sufficient. For Production, integrate through SAP BTP/CPI for dynamic payload handling and monitoring.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: BAdI that allows modification of standard fields in t...
entry.content:
Good day @Patricia122023 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

Blog: Explore Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud on SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Extensibility: Production Order Confirmation, Manage Production Orders

Extending Existing SAP Solutions Using SAP BTP

In summary, there is no released BAdI equivalent to WORKORDER_UPDATE that allows modifying standards field in the production order header at release in public cloud. SAP restricts this to maintain the clean core. Instead, you should consider using:

  • The Manage Production Orders (A2X API) to update standard header fields externally, or
  • The BD_MFGORDER_MODIFY_CUST_FIELDS BAdI to populate custom fields internally.

Whilst you cannot modify the standard order header directly, there are clean-core-compliant workarounds such as using Process Automation you may consider. You can use SAP Build Process Automation or SAP Cloud ALM process automation to:

  • Detect the order release event (via Event Mesh/Business Event ManufacturingOrder.Release).
  • Use BTP integration flow (iFlow) or REST API call to the “Manage Production Orders (A2X API_MFG_ORDER) service.
  • Update the order’s batch field using the API, this API supports PATCH operations in header data.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Mapa SAP de Belo Horizonte e região — e o que isso revela sobre o mercado local
entry.content:
Olá pessoal!

Se você trabalha com SAP aqui em Minas, se liga:

Montei um panorama composto por 60 empresas de Belo Horizonte e Região Metropolitana que usam SAP — e o resultado mostra que BH é um polo forte do país quando o assunto é transformação digital com SAP. A lista de empresas estará no final do post.

Observação  bem importante: a lista de empresas não foi gerada por IA. Foi um levantamento feito por pessoas reais. No caso o Ulisses Pereira me passou essa lista. A IA ajudou  a analisar os dados estatísticos para obter insights.

O post é longo, então se acomode na cadeira e se prepare para engajar no final. Bora movimentar a comunidade BH?

Voce trabalha ou já trabalhou em alguma dessas empresas?
👉Comenta aqui quais módulos SAP você já viu sendo usados (S/4, ECC, Ariba, DRC, BTP, EWM…).

Quer apresentar um case de projeto no próximo encontro?
Deixa um “eu topo” nos comentários!

 

Setores que mais aparecem

Para você ter uma ideia, olha como o ecossistema está distribuído por setor:

 

Setor x Nº de empresas x  Exemplos
Siderurgia e Metalurgia9Usiminas, Vallourec, ArcelorMittal, Anglo American
Construção / Engenharia6MRV, Andrade Gutierrez, ARG, Sankyu
Indústria Digital / TI6Algar Tech, ArcelorMittal Sistemas, Hinova, Zetrasoft
Energia e Gás4CEMIG, GASMIG, SA Carvalho
Bens de Consumo4Itambé, Rio Branco Alimentos, Coop Central
Varejo / Atacado4Arezzo&Co, Drogaria Araujo, Tracbel, Potencial Distribuidora
Serviços Administrativos / Locação4Localiza, EBEC, Itatiaia Móveis
Mineração2Samarco, Martins Lanna
Transporte / Logística2CBTU, Aeroporto de Confins
Outros (química, saneamento, etc.)9Magnesita, Petronas, COPASA, BRK Ambiental, entre outros

 

Cases públicos conhecidos

Ao pesquisar por informações públicas sobre essas empresas + sistemas SAP, foi retornado esses cases. Você faz parte de algum deles? Comenta aqui!

  • CEMIG / GASMIG / COPASA → plataformas SAP Utilities, CRM e ERP, com cases de transformação digital e sustentação por parceiros como SONDA.
  • Arezzo&Co → usa SAP AFS, EWM, GRC e Emarsys pra integrar indústria, loja e e-commerce.
  • Drogaria Araujo → referência nacional em SAP S/4HANA, omnichannel e automação de processos.
  • Usiminas / Gerdau / Vallourec / ArcelorMittal → projetos de Ariba, EWM, integração de cadeia de suprimentos e automação industrial.
  • MRV Engenharia → cases de integração SAP + dados em tempo real, migrando para o S/4HANA.
  • Samarco → automação de serviços e controle de contratos com SAP como backbone.
  • Localiza → usa SAP em processos administrativos e financeiros com integração a apps próprios.

 

Revelações sobre o mercado local

Considerando as informações públicas encontradas, é possível tirar as seguintes conclusões:

BH tem escala e diversidade SAP.
Desde a mineração até o varejo, há espaço pra Fiori, BTP, RAP, ABAP Cloud, DRC e S/4HANA.

Oportunidade pra profissionais.
As empresas estão em estágios diferentes de maturidade digital — e isso significa demanda por novos talentos que dominem as tecnologias modernas da SAP.

Ecossistema em expansão.
Consultorias locais, startups e universidades estão se aproximando cada vez mais do universo SAP. É o momento certo pra criar pontes e fortalecer essa comunidade.

Conclusão

Esse mapa mostra que o ecossistema SAP da Região Metropolitana de Belo Horizonte é real, grande e cheio de oportunidades.
Agora, o próximo passo é fortalecer quem faz parte dele.

👉 Quer participar dos encontros e rodas de conversa da Comunidade SAP Belo Horizonte?
👉 Quer apresentar um case?
👉 Ou quer apenas se conectar com outros profissionais que também trabalham com SAP na região?

Deixa seu comentário, seu LinkedIn ou manda uma mensagem.
A ideia é simples: criar um ambiente onde quem trabalha com SAP em Minas não precise sair de BH para ter visibilidade e oportunidades.

🚀 Vem aí o Kickoff da Comunidade SAP BH!
No dia 27 de novembro, vamos reunir a galera que vive, estuda, respira e trabalha com SAP aqui em Belo Horizonte.

A ideia é simples:
– aproximar os profissionais
– abrir portas
– compartilhar conhecimento
– e mostrar que existe um ecossistema forte de SAP em Minas.

Se você é júnior, pleno, sênior, consultor, funcional, ABAP, BASIS, estudante ou curioso… você é bem-vindo!

Quer participar?
Comenta aqui embaixo e fica de olho nas próximas novidades.

entry.title: SAP for Me S-user category is Customer, how to change it to Partner?
entry.content:
SAP for Me S-user category is Customer, but my colleague needs the S-user category Partner.

How to change it to Partner? Is it possible?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SAP for Me S-user category is Customer, how to change...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Kindly know the S-user category cannot be changed from Customer to Partner, and vice-versa.

This is documented in KBA 3553147 - Can the S-user ID "Type" (Customer/Partner) be changed in the Profile application in SAP for Me?

If you need an S-user with category Partner, then could you pls contact the SAP Partner support team via the channel introduced in KBA 1848459? S-user with category Partner needs to be created on the PartnerEdge portal.

Hope the above information helps.

Thanks and best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: RISE環境のCloudALMのセットアップ手順について
entry.content:
RISE環境のS/4システムについて、CloudALM監視をセットアップしております。
そこで質問が2点あります。

 

質問①：RISEの手順について
RISE環境のCloudALMのセットアップ手順は「SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition」の手順でよろしいでしょうか？
下記URLの設定手順が環境ごとに用意されているのですが、RISE環境の手順URLのリンクがないためお伺いした次第です。

 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Editionの手順URL：

 

質問②：RISEからの通信方式について
RISE環境のS/4サーバからCloudALMの間への通信はインターネット経由のHTTPSであってますでしょうか？
RISE内部の通信ではなく、外部通信(インターネット経由の接続)となるのか？が知りたいことです。


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: RISE環境のCloudALMのセットアップ手順について
entry.content:
ご担当者　様

平素よりお世話になっております。

回答①：はい、ご認識の通りでRISE環境のCloudALMのセットアップ手順は「SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition」の手順をご参考ください。

回答②：RISE 環境には Cloud ALM との内部通信経路がなく、インターネット経由の HTTPS 通信を使用します。

よろしくお願いいたします。

SAP サポート

entry.title: Re: Error encountered while uploading Variable Pay Template
entry.content:
Hi @Singh_28 

Release tip and tricks for Compensation experts that need to do a cutover from a preview environment to a production environment by November 14-15 when 2H 2025 gets rolled out to Production environments:

  •  In order to successfully import a compensation or variable pay template xml to production you will need to first search in the exported template from the preview environment for [hideInProfile="false" hideInForm="false"] and replace with blanks (through xml editor) otherwise you will get error messages in provisioning (the error message might not be specific to this but this is the root cause).

from here.

Best,

Xavier
